intro: Aragallus leucanthus, commonly known as the white-flowered aragallus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible or medicinal properties. Aragallus leucanthus is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments with cool temperatures.
